node.title: Police have arrested hundreds of suspected drug traffickers in a global sting, now they're going after their trusted insiders
node.alt: A man stands with his hand cuffed behind his back while a police officer stands watch.
node.description: Six months since the AFP revealed how Operation Ironside used an encrypted messaging app to listen in on organised criminals, the investigation has a new target.
node.content:
["More than 1,300 people have been arrested around the world since details of a \"covert sting\" targeting organised criminals were made public six months ago.", "The Australian Federal Police (AFP) have been leading Operation Ironside \u2013a global effort that involved investigators using an encrypted\u00a0messaging app to catch criminals over a three-year period.", "Since June, 993 people have been arrested oversees and another 311 people have been charged with more than 800 offences in Australia.", "More than six\u00a0tonnes of drugs, 139 weapons and $52 million in suspected dirty money have been seized in Australia as part of ongoing investigations.", "", "
A suspect is arrested over an alleged attempt to import cocaine into Australia from the UK.\u00a0(Supplied: AFP\u00a0)
", "AFP Assistant Commissioner Nigel Ryan said illicit drug use remained a serious problem.", "\"Outlaw motorcycle gangs, triads, cartels and Italian organised criminals are trafficking drugs into Australia at an industrial scale because of the significant profits being made,\" he said.", "\"The AFP is deeply concerned about how Australia's illicit drug use impacts national security, money laundering and the economy \u2013 we also hold grave fears about how illicit drug use is making our vulnerable communities, our suburbs and our roads less safe.", "\"We are seeing drug wars play out in the suburbs.\"", "", "
Packages seized when the AFP intercepted an alleged cocaine importation from the UK.(Supplied: AFP\u00a0)
", "The AFP has been sifting through around 19 million messages received through ANOM \u2013 the encrypted messaging app first planted into the hands of criminals in 2018.", "One message revealed how a group planned to import three tonnes of cocaine in one shipment \u2013 about half of Australia's annual consumption.", "As a result of new information, Operation Ironside is entering a new phase today, with the AFP promising to go after 160 new targets in Australia.", "NSW State Crime Commander, Assistant Commissioner Stuart Smith, said so-called \"trusted insiders\" have\u00a0 become a major focus, those who use their knowledge or connections in a workplace to help underworld figures.", "\"Police have been working hard to analyse and explore all those additional leads, specifically targeting trusted insiders and those who present the most significant threat to our communities,\" he said.", "", "
An airline freight worker from Sydney was charged with attempting to import 156 kg of pseudoephedrine into the country.(Supplied: AFP\u00a0)
", "The ABC has been told professional dive teams are being used to retrieve drugs from cargo ships arriving into places like Port Botany in Sydney.", "Some criminals are buying expensive equipment \u2013 such as small underwater scooters \u2013 to help them quickly remove drugs planted on\u00a0the hulls of ships.", "The AFP will also be looking at waste management services which are being used to collect drugs planted in garbage bins at ports across the country.", "", "
More than six tonnes of illicit drugs have been seized during Operation Ironside.(Supplied: AFP\u00a0)
", "Information from ANOM has also revealed a list of lawyers favoured by underworld figures in the event they are\u00a0charged with drug trafficking offences.", "Intelligence has shown that criminal gangs have moved to new encrypted messaging services after hundreds of them were nabbed through ANOM.", "\"You will see AFP or our state law enforcement partners executing search warrants across Australia in coming months,\" Assistant Commissioner Ryan said.", "\"It's just a matter of time before we scoop up those who believed they had gotten away with their crimes.\""]
